moves.2... d5: not very wrong: an early outbreak of d5...
moves.3. e5: also exd5, is an option: but after Nf6, White is enjoying no picknick...
moves.3... h5 4. Nf3 Bf5 5. c3: way ahead of the game: after Nc6, the Knight will have no moves...
moves.6... Nc6 7. Bd3: developing and attacking: that is the way to go...
moves.7... Bxd3 8. Qxd3 c4 9. Qc2 b5: the logical way to go, in the Sicilian...
moves.11. h3: at least no Ng4: that would spoil a lot...
moves.13... O-O: castling into trouble: in my humble opinion...
moves.14. O-O-O: indigenous in some White play against the Sicilian: castling long...
moves.14... a5 15. g4 hxg4 16. hxg4 Nh6 17. Bh: Black is all wrong here: the play is not on the Queens' wing...
moves.18. g5 Nf5 19. Rdg1: taking the venom, out of Ne3...
moves.19... g6 20. Bf2: and again, Whites' DSB restores the order...
preparing mate, after Rgh1, followed by Rh8+, Kg7, R1h7...
moves.23... Ng7 24. Rgh1 f5: after Nh5?!, Rxh5, gxh5, Rxh5, things are getting very unclear: Qc2-h7 is threatening mate; this is not better...
moves.34... a4 35. Kd1 Ng3 36. Rg1 Rxd2+: maybe the best trade for Black...
threatening Nxe6+: a simple Kf7 could do the trick...
